item.title: Identity Management In The Cloud: Best Practices
item.description: Managing and securing user identities in the cloud is getting complicated.

item.title: Ally Launches Mobile Payments Upgrades
item.description: The bank has integrated Popmoney into its mobile app, and also introduced a mobile electronic transfer function.

item.title: What Are the Real Economics of the Cloud?
item.description: Considering only the unit costs associated with the cloud doesn’t provide a true picture of the economics.

item.title: U.S. Bank Accepting Military Support Donations
item.description: U.S. Bank customers can makes donations to Operation Homefront via ATMs in 25 states.

item.title: Banks Need To Target Small Businesses For Online Payment
item.description: In the next one to three years, banks plan to support online payment processes for small and medium sized businesses.

item.title: How Banks Can Leverage Mobile Network Operators for Security
item.description: Mobile network operators are starting to take steps to open up their security infrastructure for other enterprises to leverage.

item.title: BofA Merrill Lynch Launches Cash Recycling Solution
item.description: The solution is geared towards retailers and other cash-intensive businesses.

item.title: Survey Shows 47% Increase in Information Security Spending
item.description: 11% of banking and capital markets surveyed rarely or never present security topics to the board or top governing body. Is this acceptable?

item.title: Shelter from the Storm: Business Continuity & Rethinking Disaster
item.description: The one-year anniversary of Superstorm Sandy has financial services leaders revisiting and rethinking their business continuity plans.

item.title: Customers Bank Launches Mobile Photo Bill Pay
item.description: The offering is part of the bank's enhancements to its mobile suite.

item.title: U.S. Bank Rolls Out Mobile Photo Balance Transfer
item.description: Next month U.S. Bank plans to launch Mobile Photo Balance Transfer, after seeing the success of its other mobile imaging services.

item.title: Startup Set To Introduce First Bitcoin ATM
item.description: The first ATM that exchanges cash for Bitcoins is set to go live tomorrow.

item.title: Banks Can Thrive in the New Payments World
item.description: A new NACHA white paper explores the payments crossroads banks currently face, and how to stay relevant amidst increasing competition.

item.title: How Layered Security Improves Identity Confidence and Consumer Convenience
item.description: Multi-layered security will give banks the opportunity to achieve better authentication in the mobile channel without sacrificing customer convenience.

item.title: Financial Services Mobility Spikes: Good Technology Report
item.description: An increase in device activation, due to an increase in remote workers, is seen across financial services industries, according to the Good Technology Mobility Index Report.

item.title: How to Ensure Mobile Banking App Security
item.description: Online malware is starting to make its way to the mobile world and banks will have to be increasingly proactive in protecting their customer-facing apps.

item.title: PayPal Is The Most Trusted Brand For Mobile Wallets, Says Survey
item.description: PayPal tops Google, Apple, Facebook, and Amazon as the most trusted brand for mobile wallets according to a survey by Javelin Strategy and Research.

item.title: Is Your SysAdmin Actually A Data Scientist?
item.description: Data scientists are hard to find, but you may already have someone on your team who performs the duties of a true data guru.

item.title: Survey: Majority of Employees Ready to Break BYOD Policies
item.description: A survey by Fortinet, a network security company, found younger employees are often willing to break company policies around personal mobile devices and cloud usage.

item.title: HSBC Launches Cash Management Tool in China
item.description: The solution enables corporates to submit cross-border payment documentation electronically.

item.title: Bank IT Spend Projected to Reach $215 Billion in 2014
item.description: Financial services firms overall are estimated to spend $430 billion in 2014, according to IDC Financial Insights.

item.title: SAP And SAS Partner On Big Data Analytics
item.description: SAP and SAS announced yesterday they will be partnering to offer SAS analytics applications on SAP’s HANA platform.

item.title: Experian Sold Data To Vietnamese ID Theft Ring
item.description: Fake private investigation firm tricked data broker into divulging numerous Americans' names, social security numbers, birthdates and bank account numbers.

item.title: Voice of the Customer Programs on the Rise
item.description: New research from Temkin Group finds that an overwhelming number of companies report that VoC programs deliver positive business results.

item.title: How To Get The Most Out Of Mobile Banking Apps
item.description: The growing importance of mobile is clear, and banks need to take steps now to maximize their mobile offerings to attract mobile-first customers.
